intro: Elaphoglossum bahiense, commonly known as the Brazilian water fern, is a small, delicate fern native to South America. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in dense undergrowth. Its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of its fronds, which are typically brown when mature. Elaphoglossum bahiense is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its lush, green foliage and graceful appearance.
